intro: Biscutella valentina subsp. cuneata, commonly known as the narrowleaf biscuitroot, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm, with slender stems and lanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom in early spring. The subspecies is distinguished by its narrow, elongated leaves and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils.
